description: From French cartographie, from carte (“map”) (ultimately from Ancient Greek χάρτης (khártēs, “map”)) + -graphie (“-graphy”) (, from γράφω (gráphō, “write”)); carto- +‎ -graphy.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) The creation of charts and maps based on the layout of a territory's geography. [from 19th c.]
(countable, figuratively) An illustrative discussion of a topic. [from 20th c.]
